text:
Day 59

The next environmental ticking time bomb will be toxic #PFAS and #PFOS chemicals polluting UK waters.

A regulatory vacuum.

When this breaks, remember you were told. 

 @EnvAgency @DefraWater @GeorgeMonbiot @carolecadwalla @BBCNews @Channel4News @jonsnowC4 @EnvAgencyYNE

@CamCurat @AquiferChalk @defra @EnvAgency If the EA are doing such a fabulous job your MP might want to ask why then in Nov 2019 was the Cam the only river in England recorded as having "Exceptionally low" flows?

Jun 2020, 41% long term average flows (LTA).

Jul 2020, 42% "LTA.

Aug 2020, 47% LTA.

entity.name: Family Guy
entity.description: Sick, twisted and politically incorrect, the animated series features the adventures of the Griffin family. Endearingly ignorant Peter and stay-at-home wife Lois reside in Quahog, R.I., and have three kids. Meg, the eldest child, is a social outcast, and teenage Chris is awkward and clueless when it comes to the opposite sex. The youngest, Stewie, is a genius baby bent on killing his mother and destroying the world. The talking dog, Brian, keeps Stewie in check while sipping martinis and sorting through his own life issues.

text: RT @SDC_newsdesk: Help your local community by becoming a #Flood Warden - volunteers trained to help & prepare communities at risk of flood‚Ä¶

@CamCurat @AquiferChalk Your MP that just been subject to a classic @Defra / @EnvAgency bureaucratic BS response.

According to EA update, 11th Sep, Cam is flowing at just 47% of its long term average.  

Reason? "Groundwater abstraction : Water Industry". Nice try. Try again.

https://t.co/GFs8yKsDeQ

Become a flood warden...

Have a look at this... ‚¨áÔ∏è‚¨áÔ∏è‚¨áÔ∏è

By the w‚Ä¶

Help your local community by becoming a #Flood Warden - volunteers trained to help & prepare communities at risk of flooding. Find out more https://t.co/eN83CAkUw0 @EnvAgencySE @EdenbridgeTC @EynsfordParish @ShorehamKent #sundridge https://t.co/tgeczPNOYt

urls.title: Flood wardens | Kent Prepared
urls.description: Flood wardens are volunteers trained to help and prepare people in local communities that are at risk of flooding. They play an important role in the preparing a community flood plan and putting it in to practice. They also provide a vital link between a local community and those responsible for responding to a flood. You will be the eyes and ears of the community and will help develop your local flood plan. You can choose to meet with other flood wardens in your community as often as you like, typically

text: Our #flooding inquiry heard yesterday from people directly affected by floods, and their proposals included the need for @EnvAgency & @DefraGovUK to listen to local groups ‚Äì many thanks to all those who took part and @NatFloodForum for facilitating the session https://t.co/NAbt2Wf4gb

text:
